events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision on March 28th involving their car and another vehicle at a busy intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the collision affecting the insured vehicle.
An experienced claims agent specializing in auto accidents was assigned to the case to ensure proper handling and quick responses.
The customer was sent an acknowledgment message confirming receipt of their auto accident claim and next steps in the process.
The agent requested additional documents, including police reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and witness statements.
The customer submitted all requested documentation promptly, including the official police report and multiple photos from the accident scene.
The claims investigation team began evaluating the details of the accident, reviewing all submitted evidence for liability and damage assessment.
The investigation concluded with findings confirming the insured was not at fault and the extent of damages to the vehicle were documented.
A fair settlement proposal was prepared by the claims team and sent to the customer for approval, covering vehicle repairs and rental car costs.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the prompt service and offered compensation.
Based on the investigation results and customer agreement, the claim was approved for the full settlement amount without any disputes.
The payment for the approved claim was issued directly to the repair shop and the customer for rental reimbursement, completing the transaction.
The claim was formally closed after all payments were confirmed and the customer expressed their full satisfaction with the process.
All documents and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived securely for future reference and compliance requirements.
